org.firmata4j

Interface Pin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FirmataPin

    public interface Pin
    A pin is a connector of an IODevice to external signal receiver or transmitter.
    Author:
    Oleg Kurbatov <o.v.kurbatov@gmail.com>

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Pin.Mode
      Mode represents particular duty of a pin.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEventListener(PinEventListener listener)
      Adds the specified listener to receive events from this pin.
      IODevice getDevice()
      Return an IODevice the pin belongs to.
      byte getIndex()
      Returns the index of the pin on its device.
      Pin.Mode getMode()
      Returns current mode of the pin.
      Set<Pin.Mode> getSupportedModes()
      Returns a set of modes supported by the pin.
      long getValue()
      Returns current value of the pin.
      void removeAllEventListeners()
      Remove all listeners from this pin.
      void removeEventListener(PinEventListener listener)
      Removes the specified listener so that it no longer receives events from this pin.
      void setMode(Pin.Mode mode)
      Assigns new mode to the pin.
      void setServoMode(int minPulse, int maxPulse) 
      void setValue(long value)
      Sets the value to the pin.
      boolean supports(Pin.Mode mode)
      Checks if the pin supports the mode

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        IODevice getDevice()
        Return an IODevice the pin belongs to.
        Returns:
        the pin's device

      • getIndex

        byte getIndex()
        Returns the index of the pin on its device.
        Returns:
        the index of the pin

      • getMode

        Pin.Mode getMode()
        Returns current mode of the pin.
        Returns:
        current mode of the pin

      • setMode

        void setMode(Pin.Mode mode)
      throws IOException,
             IllegalArgumentException
        Assigns new mode to the pin.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode the pin should get into
        Throws:
        IOException - when assigning is failed due a communication issue
        IllegalArgumentException - when the pin does not support the mode

      • setServoMode

        void setServoMode(int minPulse,
                  int maxPulse)
           throws IOException,
                  IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        minPulse - servo moter control pulse with [µs] on setValue(0)
        maxPulse - servo moter control pulse with [µs] on setValue(180)
        Throws:
        IOException - when assigning is failed due a communication issue
        IllegalArgumentException - when the pin does not support the mode

      • supports

        boolean supports(Pin.Mode mode)
        Checks if the pin supports the mode
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode
        Returns:
        true if the pin supports the mode, false otherwise

      • getSupportedModes

        Set<Pin.Mode> getSupportedModes()
        Returns a set of modes supported by the pin.
        Returns:
        set of supported modes

      • getValue

        long getValue()
        Returns current value of the pin.
        Returns:
        current value of the pin

      • setValue

        void setValue(long value)
       throws IOException,
              IllegalStateException
        Sets the value to the pin. It is impossible to set a value to a pin in input mode such as Pin.Mode.INPUT or Pin.Mode.ANALOG.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be assigned to the pin
        Throws:
        IOException - when setting fails due a communication issue
        IllegalStateException - when the pin is in input mode such as Pin.Mode.INPUT or Pin.Mode.ANALOG.

      • addEventListener

        void addEventListener(PinEventListener listener)
        Adds the specified listener to receive events from this pin.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(PinEventListener listener)
        Removes the specified listener so that it no longer receives events from this pin.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener

      • removeAllEventListeners

        void removeAllEventListeners()
        Remove all listeners from this pin.
